I was again permitted to breathe the fresh

native country. I did not participate in
these feelings for to me the walls of a
dungeon or a plal palace were alike
hateful – The cup of life was to me poisoned
for ever & although the sun shone upon
me as in‸upon the happy & lightgay of heart I

frightful darkness penetrated by no glimmer
but that of the light of two eyes that
glared upon me.— Sometimes they were
the expressive eyes of Henry languishing
in death — the dark orbs nearly covered by
the lid & the the long lashes that fringed
it — Sometimes it was the watry clouded
eyes of the monster as I first saw them
